result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lloyd William Perkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lloyd William Perkins appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Lloyd William Perkins.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  Attorney Harris Motions to withdraw as Counsel.  Motion GRANTED. Attorney Harris to advise the PD's Office of need for new counsel to be appointed.  Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Status of counsel hearing.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Withdraw as counsel, filed.

Court orders increase of Cash Bond in amount of $5,000.00. In addition, Court orders following modification to conditions: maintain absolute sobriety, undergo random urine screens, drug tests and breathalyzer test. All other conditions previously ordered remain the same.

Defendant Lloyd William Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Lloyd William Perkins.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Pretrial conference. Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State.  Defense requests adjournment to allow time for the Defendant to review the discovery, which was provided to him in Court. 

State requested to be heard on bail. Arguments heard as to bail. For the reasons stated on the record, the court INCREASES the cash bail an additional $5,000.00 with additional conditions. All previous conditions to remain in full force and effect. 

Defendant requests new counsel.  The Court takes the request under advisement. Case adjourned to Br. 9 for Status of counsel hearing.  Defense granted approval to appear via zoom.
Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Lloyd William Perkins not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court grants State's motion to extend discovery deadline. All discovery, with the exception of crime lab reports, must be turned over no later than 6/21/22 by the end of the day. Court sets new deadline of 08/26/2022 for filing any new motions or any plea forms. Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.
The court will address the motion filed by the State on 6/3/2022 to modify the discovery deadline at the hearing on 6/21/2022.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. Motion for Modification of Briefing Schedule

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Lloyd William Perkins not in court, in custody.  amy E spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Court set the following filing date deadlines; May 31st, 2022 for all discovery except for crime lab reports and June 17th, 2022 for any motions or plea forms. Parties notified the court that an arraignment has not been completed on the case. CASE PASSED.

CASE RECALLED. Same appearances with defendant Lloyd Perkins in attendance via Zoom from the Milwaukee County Jail.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Lloyd William Perkins in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Lloyd William Perkins in custody.   BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO. A  bby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF523.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Vashaun Young    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lloyd William Perkins not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Matter in court for preliminary hearing. SPD needs more time to appoint counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  No driving without a valid license.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lloyd William Perkins in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Defendant Lloyd William Perkins in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lloyd William Perkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
